sentences.english: We had only to stretch out our hands and take them.
sentences.chinese: 我们只须伸出手去，将其擒获。

sentences.english: The militant has been the policeman tackled, children safe from danger.

sentences.english: He didn’t have any time to react before cops stormed in and placed him under arrest.
sentences.chinese: 他还没来及反应，警察已经冲入房里，将他擒获。

sentences.english: This a few people are chased hastily, capture it at a draught obtained.

sentences.english: It has been many long years until he was captured.
Xu Boxuan takes any safer, wear a commanders trust.

definition: to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
to catch/to grapple with/to hold onto
(of a thief, smuggler etc) to be caught with stolen or illegal goods/to be caught red-handed
